properties.name: Annual Shrimp Boat Festival (held in May)
properties.description: Posted by Hiddenrill I put the skull icon because along with the shrimp boats docking, come the *pirates.* These guys take their role seriously...who knows, maybe they never come out of it. Anyway, it is a great weekend to visit Amelia Island. Awesome food. Knights of Columbus sell AWESOME brauts. Of course there is shrimp available everywhere, as is *Pirates\' Punch*. Then on Sunday...there is the Blessing of the Fleet. I suppose everyone tries to forgive themselves for all the debauchery of that weekend. ha.

properties.name: Cape Henry Inn, Ft. Story, VA - MWR hotel - but RIGHT on the beach. Not the Four Seasons, but mile long private beach. AWESOME
properties.description: Posted by Hiddenrill Funny story: I had the "rucksack" baby backpack strapped on, early one morning for a walk on the beach to see the dolphin pods go out to sea (from the Ches.Bay). Here comes this bedraggled Bill Murray look-a-like, walking down the beach towards me. God knows how long he had to walk from the VABCH bar area to get where we were, but he was coming straight towards us, and I\'m all bowed up ready to take him down, WITH a gaggling child on my back if he starts getting freaky. Turns out he was just wanting to tell me "Hey man, look at all the dolphins out there..." and then he goes and jumps in the water and swims towards them. Alrighteeee-then. Walks over. Back to the room.

properties.name: Do NOT break down here. Especially on the weekend.
properties.description: Posted by Hiddenrill Take it from someone who has. You\'ll wait 45 min. while a mechanic drives from Homerville, toting his family, a grill, and a load of those *redhot* hotdogs to cook while he fixes your car. NO I\'m not kidding.

properties.name: PCS Stop-over to West Point
properties.description: Posted by Hiddenrill My first and hopefully, only trip to Myrtle Beach. Wasn\'t the vision I had...but then I was counting on it looking like the movie "Shag." One of my ALLtime favorites. No, seriously. It was just a stop over on our way to West Point. We stayed in the hotel one night, or a "partial night." As soon as the fire alarm began to go off periodically around 0230 and the night manager would come over some sort of PA system and say in the WORST drawl I have ever heard (and I\'m from GA, folks), PUH-leeez, dis-RUHEE-GUAAARRD the ALARUUM. Over, and over, and over. Omigod. That was it, we checked out around 0330 and headed to DC. Our next stop-over. My FAVE city! EVER.

properties.name: St. Joseph's Oratory on Mount Royal
properties.description: Posted by Hiddenrill Unbelievable to watch people come from all around the world, and ascend *on their KNEES* up the middle 100 steps to the shrine. I forgot how many steps total, but it seemed like about 300 by the time we got up there... VERY awe-inspiring to visit this HUGE shrine to St. Joseph if you are Catholic.
